hints.content:
Since the price per pound of coffee was $\$0.51$ in $2008$, which corresponds to $t=0$, the graph goes through the point $(0,0.51)$. In addition, the slope is $0.18$, because the price increased $\$0.18$  each year.  There is only one graph with these two features:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: In this graph, the horizontal axis is t and the vertical axis is P. There is a line that passes through the points 0 comma 0.51 and 1 comma 0.69.

hints.content:
We also see that  the equation of the line is:

$\qquad P=0.18t+0.51$

The graph we chose above is the graph of this equation.

options.alt: In this graph, the horizontal axis is t and the vertical axis is P. There is a line that passes through the points 0 comma 0.51 and 1 comma 0.69.

question.content:
#[](http://www.statista.com/statistics/250186/average-price-of-coffee-worldwide-by-coffee-type/)

The average price of a certain type of coffee worldwide was $\$0.51$ per pound in $2008$.  The average price per pound increased about $\$0.18$ each year until $2014$, and is expected to do so for the next two years.    Which of the following graphs represents the relationship between years after $2008$, $t$, and price per pound, $P$, in dollars, of this  coffee worldwide?

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This graph a $P$-intercept of $1$ instead of $0.5$.
choices.content: ![In this graph, the horizontal axis is t and the vertical axis is P. There is a line that passes through the points 0 comma 1 and 1 comma 1.18. ](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0d8aac2e882daf59cef1a901492fac35df86a1a7)

![In this graph, the horizontal axis is t and the vertical axis is P. There is a line that passes through the points 0 comma 0.51 and 1 comma 0.69.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/8263e3ed6f384a582899506e3a7c6b586e277733)

choices.clue: This graph has a slope of $1$ instead of $0.18$.
choices.content: ![In this graph, the horizontal axis is t and the vertical axis is P. There is a line that passes through the points 0 comma 0.51 and 1 comma 1.51.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/cdc7eb6098eddc8b2f9ea0efe185e82f105ac579)

choices.clue: This graph does not have a $P$-intercept of $0.5$.
